public class zeta.format.impl.FormatBeside

(source file: impl/FormatBeside.java)

                           +----zeta.format.impl.FormatBeside
The pure class interface. 
public class FormatBeside
  extends CompoundFormat
This is a compound Format class for a list of Formats that should be printed 'beside' each other. This means, that each text after the first is printed * beside the end of the last line of the text before it. Thus, each additional text has an indentation which is increased by the lengths of the last lines of the texts before it.

This behaviour is only used, if all component formats would fit into the given maximal width. If not, the default behaviour (to print the components beneath each other) is assumed.

A specialization of this class, the class FormatGroup, is especially useful in formatting bracketed constructs where the brackets shall appear beside the first and last items of the contents of the brackets.

A text-rectangle of a FormatBeside format could look like this: 
  ...________________........
  : |                |      :
  : |  ....__________|______:
  :.|__:__|                 |
  :    :  |    ...._________|
  :    :..|____:__|       | :
  :            :  |    ___|.:
  :............:..|___|

Author:
Jacob Wieland (ughosage@cs.tu-berlin.de)
See also:
FormatGroup, CompoundFormat, Format
